alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Boundary and east central Bonner Counties through 145 PM PDT... At 120 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Troy, or 17 miles south of Bonners Ferry, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Boundary and east central Bonner Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
